required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Random Selection of Patients From the SENTRY Study Who Have a Bioconverted Sentry IVC Filter in Situ With a Minimum Dwell Time of 24 Months From a Single Center Follow up
clinical_study.official_title: A Random Selection of Patients From the SENTRY Study Who Have a Bioconverted Sentry IVC Filter in Situ With a Minimum Dwell Time of 24 Months From a Single Center

lead_sponsor.agency: NC Heart and Vascular Research, LLC

collaborator.agency: Novate Medical Limited, a BTG Group Company

clinical_study.source: NC Heart and Vascular Research, LLC

brief_summary.textblock: IVUS Evaluation of the Bioabsorbable Sentry IVC Filter 3-5 Years Post Deployment Follow up

detailed_description.textblock: IVUS Evaluation of the Bioabsorbable Sentry IVC Filter 3-5 Years Post Deployment Follow up

primary_outcome.measure: Patency of the inferior vena cava
Impact of the Sentry cylindrical frame on the vessel wall evaluation for endothelialization and neointimal hyperplasia and wall dynamics
primary_outcome.description: Impact of the Sentry cylindrical frame on the vessel wall evaluation for endothelialization and neointimal hyperplasia and wall dynamics

primary_outcome.measure: Presence and characterization of adherent thrombus
primary_outcome.description: Presence and characterization of adherent thrombus

study_pop.textblock: Subjects with at least 24 months dwell time will undergo IVUS assessment of the inferior vena cava

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18 years of age
- Signed the informed consent document
- Participants from the SENTRY clinical trial willing to undergo one time IVUS evaluation ( outpatient )
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any filter that remained non converted.
